page.title: 02FARM BUILDINGS IN HAUGHTON
page.content: ----------------------------- There are nine tenanted farms in Haughton district under one ownership. Rent reviews are held every three years and under present rules the tenancy may be passed on to the son. Two other farms belong to two different owners, one a business man the other is part of a large estate. Some so-called farms are now private houses with an acre or two for a horse, the owners being business people. Land from some of these farms has been put to adjoining farms. Cottages once attached to farms are on the whole no longer tied. There is a group of six council houses. The two largest houses known as Halls are set in extensive grounds, two other Halls are farmhouses.
